Author: Bucky Fuller
Quote: When I'm working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I think only how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong

Author: Conway's Law
Quote: Organizations which design systems ... are constrained to produce designs which are copies of the communication structures of these organizations.

Author: W. Edwards Deming
Quote: In god we trust; all others must bring data

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Everybody in this country should learn to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think

Author: Dean Lister
Quote: Simple, not easy

Author: John Paul Jones
Quote: Those who will not risk cannot win

Author: Nietzsche
Quote: He who has a Why to live for can bear almost any How

Author: Mike Tyson
Quote: Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the face

Author: Kent Beck
Quote: For each desired change, make the change easy (warning: this may be hard), then make the easy change

Author: Harold S Kushner
Quote: Forces beyond our control can take away everything you possess except one thing, your freedom to choose how to respond to the situation.

Author: Joe Sperano
Quote: Good design is obvious. Great design is transparent.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.

Author: Henry Ford
Quote: You can't build a reputation on what you're going to do

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, but wiser people are so full of doubts.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.

Author: Joseph Stalin
Quote: The death of one man is a tragedy. The death of a million is a statistic.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one thing that heralds new discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but "That's funny...

Author: Guy Kawasaki
Quote: the genesis of great companies is answering simple questions that change the world, not the desire to become rich

Author: Derek Sivers
Quote: The first follower is what turns a lone nut into a leader

Author: Reid Hoffman
Quote: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.

Author: Bruce lee
Quote: Do not pray for an easy life; pray for the strength to endure a difficult one

Author: Guy Kawasaki
Quote: Good people accept accountability. Great people ask for it.

Author: Oscar wilde
Quote: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes

Author: John Steinbeck
Quote: Socialism never took root in America because the poor see themselves as not as an exploited proletariat but as temporarily embarrassed millionaires.

Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Quote: No hables Al menos que puedas mejorar el silencio (don't speak unless you can improve on the silence)

Author: Vince Lombardi
Quote: Winning isn't everything, but the will to prepare to win is everything.

Author: Michael Scott
Quote: Fool me once, shame on you. fool me twice, strike three

Author: TS Eliot
Quote: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.

Author: Peter Drucker
Quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all

Author: Henry Ford
Quote: If I'd listened to customers I would have given them a faster horse

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education

Author: Alan Kay
Quote: It's easier to invent the future than to predict it

Author: Alan Kay
Quote: Point if view is worth 80 iq points

Author: Sam Altman
Quote: The days are long but the decades are short

Author: Jeff Bezos
Quote: You don't feel 30% smarter when the stock price goes up by 30%, so when the stock price goes down, you shouldn't feel 30% dumber

Author: Benjamin Graham
Quote: In the short term the stock market is a voting machine. in the long term it's a weighing machine.

Author: Tren Griffen
Quote: Assigning single factor causation to the output of complex adaptive system is a triumph of hope over experience

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: We all too often have socialism for the rich and rugged free market capitalism for the poor.

Author: Peter thiel
Quote: Every day you survive your life expectancy increases by 5 or 6 hours

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it ... he who doesn't ... pays it.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated

Author: Jeff Bezos
Quote: There are two kinds of companies, those that work to try to charge more and those that work to charge less. We will be the second.

Author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
Quote: The ability to observe without evaluating is the highest form of intelligence.

Author: Chinese proverb
Quote: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now

Author: Eric Hoffer
Quote: You can never get enough of what you don’t really need.

Author: Taoist Text
Quote: When the wrong man uses the right means, the right means work in the wrong way

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
Quote: If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.

Author: Phil Karlton
Quote: There are only two hard things in Computer Science: cache invalidation and naming things.

Author: Barbara Wootton
Quote: It’s from the champions of the impossible, rather than from slaves of the possible, that evolution draws its creative force

Author: Greek Proverb
Quote: A society grows great when old men plant trees in whose shade they shall never sit

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.

Author: Bucky Fuller
Quote:
You never change things by fighting the existing reality.
To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete.

Author: Sophocles
Quote: Nothing vast enters the life of mortals without a curse.

Author: Mark Boulton
Quote: You can create good experiences without knowing the content. What you can’t do is create good experiences without knowing your content structure. What is your content made from, not what your content is.

Author: Yann LeCun
Quote: Our intelligence is what makes us human, and AI is an extension of that quality

Author: Ian MacDonald
Quote: Any AI smart enough to pass a Turing test is smart enough to fail it

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: If I have seen further than others it is by standing on the shoulders of giants

Author: Richard Feynman
Quote: What I cannot create, I do not understand

Author: Confucious
Quote: We all have two lives, the second one starts when you realise you only have one

Author: Dwight D Eisenhower
Quote: In preparing for battle I have always found that plans are useless but planning is indispensable

Author: Blaise Pascal
Quote: All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone.

Author: Nassim Taleb
Quote: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.

Author: Otto von Bismarck
Quote: If revolution there is to be, let us rather undertake it not undergo it

Author: Victor Hugo
Quote: Nothing is as powerful as an idea whose time has come

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

Author: Arthur C Clarke
Quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.

Author: @TheTweetOfGod
Quote:
Intelligence looks in the mirror and sees ignorance. 
Ignorance looks in the mirror it sees intelligence.

Author: Margaret Bonanno
Quote: Being rich is having money; being wealthy is having time

Author: Sigmund Freud
Quote: A civilization which leaves so large a number of its participants unsatisfied and drives them into revolt neither has nor deserves the prospect of a lasting existence.

Author: Rumi
Quote: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear

Author: Adam Smith
Quote: It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewery or the baker, that we expect our dinner, but from  their regard to their own interest

Author: Andy Grove
Quote: Only the paranoid survive

Author: Scott Galloway
Quote: As a species we are easier to fool than convince we've been fooled

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, than fairness, give me truth

Author: Warren Buffet
Quote: Be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful

Author: Vitalik Buterin
Quote: The thing that I often ask startups on top of Ethereum is, 'Can you please tell me why using the Ethereum blockchain is better than using Excel?' And if they can come up with a good answer, that's when you know you've got something really interesting.

Author: Carl Jung
Quote: People don't have ideas. ideas have people.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them

Author: Chinese proverb
Quote: The Winds Of Change Blow, Some People Build Walls, Others Build Windmills

Author: Martin Fowler
Quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

Author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin
Quote: There are decades where nothing happens; and there are weeks where decades happen.

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: what can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence

Author: James Clear
Quote: The more you let a single belief define you, the less capable you are of adapting when life challenges you.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: It ain’t what you don’t know that gets you into trouble.It’s what you know for sure that just ain’t so.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr
Quote: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice

Author: Dwight D Eisenhower
Quote:
Every gun that is made, every warship launched, every rocket fired signifies, in the final sense, a theft from those who hunger and are not fed, those who are cold and are not clothed.

This world in arms is not spending money alone. It is spending the sweat of its laborers, the genius of its scientists, the hopes of its children...

This is not a way of life at all, in any true sense. Under the cloud of threatening war, it is humanity hanging from a cross of iron.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein
Quote: A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects.

Author: Confucius
Quote: A sick man only wants one thing, a healthy man wants 10,000 things.

Author: Archimedes
Quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world

Author: Eleanor Roosevelt
John von Neumann
Quote: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.

Author: Leonardo davinci
Quote: I have offended God and mankind because my work did not reach the quality it should have.

Author: Eric Weinstein
Quote: We are now gods but for the wisdom

Author: Sun Tzu
Quote: Opportunities multiply as they are seized

Author: Jack Butcher
Quote: Own assets or sell time

Author: G. K. Chesterton
Quote: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.

Author: Paul Graham
Quote: Experts teach themselves

Author: General Omar Bradley
Quote: Amateurs talk strategy. Professionals talk logistics.

Author: Naval Ravikant
Quote: Innovation is the child of freedom and the parent of prosperity

Author: Sam Walton
Quote: There is only one boss—the customer. And he can fire everybody in the company from the chairman on down, simply by spending his money somewhere else.

Author: Seneca
Quote: Men are thrifty in guarding their private property, but as soon as it comes to wasting time, they are most extravagant with the one commodity for which it's respectable to be greedy

Author: John Stuart Mill
Quote: He who knows only his own side of the case knows little of that.

Author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
Quote: With my family, I’m a communist. With my close friends, I’m a socialist. At the state level of politics, I’m a Democrat. At higher levels, I’m a Republican, and at the federal levels, I’m a Libertarian.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

Author: Winston Churchill
Quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often

Author: Einstein
Quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change

Author: Yiddish Proverb
Quote: Words should be weighed, not counted

Author: Leon Trotsky
Quote: You may not be interested in war, but war is interested in you.

Author: Thomas Sowell
Quote: There are no solutions. There are only trade-offs

Author: Billy Idol
Quote: I love it when someone insults me. That means that I don't have to be nice anymore.

Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Quote: The test of a first-rate intellect is the ability to hold two opposing ideas in your head at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.

Author: Jean-Michel Basquiat
Quote: Art is how we decorate space, music is how we decorate time.

Author: Hunter S Thompson
Quote: Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!

Author: Daniel Kahneman
Quote: No one ever made a decision because of a number. They need a story.

Author: Emmy Noether
Quote: If one proves the equality of two numbers a and b by showing first that a ≤ b and then that  a ≥ b, it is unfair; one should instead show that they are really equal by disclosing the inner ground for their equality.

Author: Thucydides
Quote: The society that separates its scholars from its warriors will have its thinking done by cowards and its fighting by fools

Author: Robert Heinlein
Quote: When one teaches, two learn.

Author: Alexander von Humboldt
Quote: The most dangerous worldview is the worldview of those who have not viewed the world.

Author: Charles Addams
Quote: Normal is an illusion. What is normal for the spider is chaos for the fly.

Author: Charlie Munger
Quote: Never, ever, think about something else when you should be thinking about the power of incentives.

Author: Salvador Dali Tags
Quote: I don't do drugs. I am drugs.

Author: Epictetus
Quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.

Author: Jeff Bezos
Quote: Stress primarily comes from not taking action over something that you can have some control over… stress comes from ignoring things that you shouldn’t be ignoring.

Author: Andy Benoit
Quote: Most geniuses—especially those who lead others—prosper not by deconstructing intricate complexities but by exploiting unrecognized simplicities.

Author: Jack Kerouac
Quote: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.

Author: Native American parable
Quote:
Grandson: "A fight is going on inside me. It is a terrible fight and it is between two wolves. One is evil. The other is good. Which wolf will win?” 
Old Cherokee: "The one you feed.

Author: Werner Heisenberg
Quote: Only a few know, how much one must know to know how little one knows.

Author: Heraclitus
Quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

Author: Miyamoto Musashi
Quote: Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world.
